words.definition: Anything that people or animals eat to live and grow.
sentences: We need food to stay healthy.
What is your favorite food?
The picnic basket was full of food.

words.definition: To put food into your mouth and swallow it.
sentences: I like to eat apples.
We eat dinner at 7 PM.
Don't eat too fast.

words.definition: To swallow a liquid.
sentences: I need a drink of water.
What do you want to drink?
It's important to drink enough water.

words.definition: The first meal of the day, usually eaten in the morning.
sentences: I eat cereal for breakfast.

Breakfast is the most important meal.

words.definition: A meal eaten in the middle of the day.
sentences: We had sandwiches for lunch.
Let's meet for lunch tomorrow.
Lunch break is at 12:30 PM.

words.definition: The main meal of the day, usually eaten in the evening.
sentences: What's for dinner tonight?
We had pasta for dinner.
Dinner with family is special.

words.definition: A small amount of food eaten between meals.
sentences: I need a quick snack.
Fruits are healthy snacks.
Do you want a snack before dinner?

words.definition: The sweet, fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seed and can be eaten.
sentences: Apples are my favorite fruit.

The fruit salad was delicious.

words.definition: A plant or part of a plant used as food.
sentences: Carrots are a healthy vegetable.

words.definition: The flesh of an animal eaten as food.
sentences: Do you eat meat?

words.definition: A food made from flour, water, and yeast, mixed together and baked.
sentences: I like to eat bread with butter.

words.definition: Small grains from a plant, used as food, especially in Asian countries.
sentences: We eat rice with our meals.

words.definition: A food made from flour, water, and sometimes eggs, formed into various shapes and dried.
sentences: I love to eat pasta with tomato sauce.

words.definition: A food made from milk, pressed into a solid mass.
sentences: Would you like some cheese on your sandwich?
I like cheddar cheese.
Cheese goes well with crackers.

words.definition: A white liquid produced by mammals as food for their young.
sentences: I drink milk every morning.

words.definition: A clear liquid that has no color, taste, or smell, essential for life.

words.definition: The liquid that comes from fruit or vegetables.

words.definition: A dark, bitter drink made from roasted coffee beans.

words.definition: A drink made by pouring hot water onto dried leaves of the tea plant.

words.definition: A sweet substance used to make food and drinks sweet.

words.definition: A thick, smooth liquid that is used in cooking.

words.definition: An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, or insect, containing a young creature.
sentences: I like scrambled eggs for breakfast.

words.definition: A powder made from grain, used for making bread, cakes, and pastry.

words.definition: A liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water.

words.definition: A small, flat, sweet cake.

words.definition: A sweet brown food made from cocoa beans.

words.definition: Having a taste like sugar or honey.

words.definition: To prepare food by heating it.

words.definition: To heat a liquid until bubbles appear and it turns into steam.

words.definition: To flow or cause to flow in a steady stream.

sentences: I had a bagel with cream cheese.

words.definition: A liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water.
sentences: This chicken soup is delicious.
I like to eat soup on a cold day.

words.definition: A dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid.
sentences: My grandma makes the best beef stew.

words.definition: A dish, especially in South Asian cuisine, containing meat or vegetables cooked in a spicy sauce.
sentences: I love Indian curry.

Do you prefer mild or spicy curry?

words.definition: A dish of Chinese origin consisting of small pieces of meat and vegetables fried quickly in a wok or pan.
sentences: Let's make a vegetable stir-fry for dinner.
Stir-fry is a quick and healthy meal.

words.definition: A traditional Mexican dish consisting of a corn or wheat tortilla folded or rolled around a filling.
sentences: I want to eat tacos for lunch.
Tacos are fun to customize with different toppings.

words.definition: A Mexican dish consisting of a tortilla wrapped around a filling, typically of meat, beans, or cheese.
sentences: I ordered a chicken burrito.

words.definition: A Japanese dish consisting of small balls or rolls of vinegar-flavored cold rice served with fish, vegetables, or egg.
sentences: I love to eat sushi.
Sushi is a healthy and delicious option.

words.definition: A strip, strand, or tube of pasta or a similar dough, usually made with egg and usually eaten with a sauce or in soup.
sentences: I like chicken noodle soup.

words.definition: A dish consisting of rice served in a bowl, often with other ingredients on top.

words.definition: A thick, smooth drink made from blended fruit or vegetables, sometimes with milk or yogurt.
sentences: I make a fruit smoothie every morning.

words.definition: A cold drink made of milk, ice cream, and often flavoring, mixed together until frothy.
sentences: I ordered a chocolate milkshake.
Milkshakes are a sweet treat.

words.definition: A carbonated soft drink.

words.definition: A drink made from lemon juice, sugar, and water.
sentences: I love homemade lemonade on a hot day.

words.definition: Tea that has been chilled and is served with ice.
sentences: I'll have an iced tea, please.

words.definition: A hot drink made from cocoa powder or chocolate and milk or water.
sentences: I like hot chocolate with whipped cream.

words.definition: A strong, black coffee made by forcing steam through ground coffee beans.
sentences: I start my day with an espresso.

words.definition: A type of coffee made with espresso and steamed milk, often with a layer of foam on top.
sentences: I'll have a vanilla latte, please.

words.definition: A coffee drink made with espresso, hot milk, and steamed milk foam.
sentences: I like a cappuccino with my breakfast.

This cappuccino is perfectly foamy.

words.definition: A type of coffee drink prepared by diluting an espresso with hot water.
sentences: I prefer an Americano to a regular coffee.
An Americano is a simple coffee drink.

words.definition: A small, fried cake of sweetened dough, typically in the shape of a ring or ball, sometimes filled.
sentences: He loves glazed doughnuts.
Let's get some doughnuts and coffee.

words.definition: Dough of flour, water, and shortening, used as a base or covering in baked dishes.
sentences: She made a delicious apple pastry.

words.definition: A baked dish of fruit, meat, or vegetables, typically with a top and base of pastry.

words.definition: An open pastry case with a sweet or savory filling.

words.definition: A baked savory tart with a filling of custard, cheese, and often bacon or other ingredients.
sentences: I had a slice of spinach quiche for lunch.

words.definition: A small, plain, unsweetened or lightly sweetened cake, typically made from flour, butter, and milk, and baked.
sentences: I love scones with clotted cream and jam.

words.definition: A traditional British meal of roasted meat, potatoes, and vegetables.

words.definition: A dish of minced meat topped with a layer of mashed potato.

words.definition: A large breakfast typically including bacon, eggs, sausages, baked beans, mushrooms, and toast.

words.definition: A sweet dish eaten at the end of a meal.

words.definition: A dish of food baked and served in a deep dish.
sentences: My mom made a chicken and vegetable casserole.

words.definition: To cook food over direct heat, usually on a metal frame.
sentences: Let's grill some burgers for the barbecue.

words.definition: A meal or gathering at which food is cooked outdoors on a grill or spit.
sentences: We're having a barbecue this weekend.

words.definition: An outing where a packed meal is eaten outdoors.
sentences: Let's go for a picnic in the park.

words.definition: A meal consisting of several dishes from which guests serve themselves.
sentences: The hotel offers a breakfast buffet.

words.definition: The business of providing food service at remote sites or events.
sentences: The catering for the event was excellent.

words.definition: A person whose job is to serve customers in a restaurant.
sentences: The waiter took our order.

words.definition: A woman whose job is to serve customers in a restaurant.
sentences: The waitress brought our drinks.

words.definition: A professional cook, typically the chief cook in a restaurant or hotel.
sentences: The chef prepared a special dish.

words.definition: A person whose trade is baking bread and cakes.
sentences: The baker makes fresh bread every morning.

words.definition: A person who sells meat.

words.definition: A person who sells fresh fruit and vegetables.

words.definition: A person who sells fish.

words.definition: Products made from milk.

words.definition: A place where bread, cakes, and pastries are baked or sold.

words.definition: A shop where meat is sold.

words.definition: A place where fish and seafood are sold.

words.definition: A market where farmers sell their produce directly to consumers.
sentences: We buy fresh vegetables at the farmers' market.

words.definition: A shop selling unusual or foreign prepared foods.
sentences: I bought some gourmet cheese at the delicatessen.

words.definition: A meal or food bought from a restaurant or shop to be eaten elsewhere.
sentences: Let's get a Chinese takeaway tonight.

words.definition: Food that is cooked and sold by a restaurant or store to be eaten elsewhere.
sentences: Let's order some takeout for dinner.
This restaurant has great takeout options.

words.definition: To eat a meal in a restaurant rather than taking it away.
sentences: Do you want to dine in or get takeout?

It's nice to dine in sometimes.

words.definition: Food that can be prepared and served quickly.
sentences: Hamburgers and fries are fast food.

words.definition: Food that is unhealthy but quick and easy to eat.
sentences: Candy and soda are junk food.

Junk food can be tempting.

words.definition: Food produced without the use of artificial chemicals, fertilizers, or pesticides.
sentences: I prefer to buy organic food.

words.definition: A person who does not eat meat or fish.
sentences: My sister is a vegetarian.
This restaurant has many vegetarian options.

words.definition: A person who does not eat or use any animal products.
sentences: She is a vegan and eats no meat or dairy.

words.definition: Not containing gluten, a protein found in wheat and other grains.
sentences: This bread is gluten-free.
Many people choose gluten-free options.

words.definition: Not containing milk or milk products.
sentences: This ice cream is dairy-free.
I need dairy-free milk for my coffee.

words.definition: Not containing nuts, especially for people with allergies.
sentences: This cake is nut-free for those with allergies.
The school has a strict nut-free policy.
Look for nut-free labels if you have an allergy.

words.definition: A medical condition that causes someone to react badly to certain substances.
sentences: I have a peanut allergy.

words.definition: The food and drink usually eaten by a person or animal.
sentences: I'm trying to eat a healthier diet.
What kind of diet do you follow?
A balanced diet is important for health.

words.definition: The process of providing or obtaining the food necessary for health and growth.
sentences: Good nutrition is vital for children's development.
Learn about proper nutrition for a healthy life.

words.definition: A unit of energy supplied by food.
sentences: This snack has a lot of calories.
Counting calories can help with weight loss.
Fruits are low in calories.

words.definition: A substance found in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, that is important for growth and health.
sentences: Meat and beans are good sources of protein.
Protein helps build muscles.
Athletes need a lot of protein.

words.definition: A substance found in foods such as sugar, bread, and potatoes, that provides energy.
sentences: Pasta is rich in carbohydrates.
Carbohydrates provide energy for your body.
Choose complex carbohydrates for sustained energy.

words.definition: A natural oily substance found in animal bodies, especially when deposited as a layer under the skin or around certain organs.
sentences: Avocados contain healthy fats.
Too much unhealthy fat is bad for your heart.
Trim the fat from the meat.

words.definition: Any of a group of organic compounds that are essential for normal growth and nutrition and are required in small quantities in the diet.
sentences: Oranges are rich in Vitamin C.
Eat fruits and vegetables for essential vitamins.
Vitamin D is important for bone health.

words.definition: A solid, inorganic substance of natural occurrence, important for health.
sentences: Calcium is an important mineral for bones.
Spinach is rich in iron, a vital mineral.
Drink mineral water for added benefits.

words.definition: The part of plant food that is not digested but helps food pass through the body.
sentences: Eat foods high in fiber for good digestion.
Oats are a good source of fiber.
Fiber helps you feel full.

words.definition: The process of breaking down food into substances that the body can use.
sentences: Eating slowly aids digestion.
Good digestion is important for overall health.
Some foods are harder to digest.
